intro: Reichardia picroides subsp. eu-picroides, commonly known as the European tansy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble single flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are pinnately divided and covered in fine hairs. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Reichardia picroides subsp. eu-picroides is often found in moist meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
